may i say you are _full_ of good ideas, *fuller*

I want to see image optimization before lazy loading. Lazy loading is an SEO trick that only stalls the loading of heavy images. Gettting the most optimized image files to the user gives them a better experience than lazy loading.
Hey David, have you seen this yet? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-pages-editor/customize-an-images-optimization-settings>
Please let me know if this solves for what you are suggesting. Also, if you have any feedback on this, please let us know as well :slightly_smiling_face:
I didn't know it was an option already :thumbsup:. But I mentioned it more to make the point that lazy loading is not in the best interest of the site visitors at the moment.

If done right lazyloading is very good idea. I try not to lazyload blindly. But loading the images well before the roll into view tends to give the perception that they arent lazyloaded but you get the added benefit of not having to laod images you arent or havent seen. I also belive that the images you lazyload should be optimized as well. That is vital as you said for optimal user experience.
